item.title: Vue.js Cli: How to Use Multiple vue.config.js Configs
item.description: It can be useful to have more than one configuration file, for example, to build several code bundles. The config file to use can be set with VUE_CLI_SERVICE_CONFIG_PATH environment variable: # Build using vue.config.public.js CONF=`realpath vue.config.public.js` VUE_CLI_SERVICE_CONFIG_PATH=$CONF npm run build -- --mode production # build using vue.config.js npm run build -- --mode production Where npm run build is defined in package.json as vue-cli-service build. It is also possible to create several bundles using vue cli multi-page mode, but in this case we will have big common js and css “vendors” package.
